sen.j: 宝生流（ほうしょうりゅう）は能楽におけるワキ方の流儀の一つ。
sen.e: The hosho school is a style of Waki-kata in Nogaku.
The Hosho school is a style of Waki-kata in Nohgaku.
The Hosho school is a style of Waki-kata in Nohgaku.

sen.j: シテ方宝生流と区別して下掛宝生流（略して「下宝生」「下宝」または「ワキ宝」）とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: It is also called Shimogakari-hosho-school ('shimohosho', 'shimoho' or 'wakiho' for short) to differentiate from Shite-kata (main roles) hosho school.
sen.cmt: 用語集ではShimogakari-hosho-ryuとなっていましたが、タイトルの方でHosho schoolとなっているのでShimogakari-hosho-schoolとしました。「下宝」「ワキ宝」の読み方は推測です。
sen.e: It is also called the Shimogakari Hosho school ('Shimohosho,' 'Shimoho' or 'Wakiho' for short) to differentiate from the Shite-kata (main roles) Hosho school.
sen.cmt: the Shimogakari Hosho school、Shimohosho、Shimoho、Wakiho、the Shite-kata (main roles) Hosho schoolとし、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: It is also called the Shimogakari Hosho school ('Shimohosho,' 'Shimoho' or 'Wakiho' for short) to differentiate from the Shite-kata (main roles) Hosho school.

sen.j: 明治時代以降ワキ方の諸流派が没落していった。
sen.e: After Meiji Period, Waki-kata schools lost their positions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 結果、現在では最大流派となっている。
sen.e: As a result, the hosho school became the largest school.

sen.j: ワキ方五流のうちではもっとも後発である。
sen.e: It has started the latest among Five styles of Waki-kata.

sen.j: 徳川綱吉による宝生流優遇策の一環として、春藤流（金春流座付）より出て一家を成した。
sen.e: The school is founded by branching off from Shundo-school (Konparu-school zatsuki (working in the theater)), as a part of favorable treatment to the hosho school by Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: このため上掛のシテ方の座付でありながら、金春流の影響を受けた下掛の芸風を残している。
sen.e: Therefore the hosho school still leaves a performance style of shimogakari that has an influence of konparu-school, though the hosho school is a zatsuki of uwagake (a cover) Shite-kata.

sen.j: これが「下掛宝生流」という別名の由来となっている。
sen.e: This is a origin of another name, 'Shimogakari-hosho-school'.

sen.j: 大名家の庇護を失った明治維新直後には、他のワキ方の例に漏れずきわめて困窮した。
sen.e: Directly after Meiji Restoration, when protection of Daimyo family (feudal lord family) was lost, the school was in hard straits like other Waki-kata.

sen.j: しかし、八世宗家宝生新朔が東京を離れずに演能活動を続けた。
sen.e: However Shinsaku HOSHO, the eighth familyhead, did not leave Tokyo and continued En-noh (performing a Noh play) activity.

sen.j: 子の宝生新（十世宗家）、女婿宝生弥一・森茂好らが名手として活躍した。
sen.e: His son Arata HOSHO (the tenth familyhead), son-in-law Yaichi HOSHO and Shigeyoshi MORI were actively involved as master dancers.

sen.j: また江戸時代から素謡教授として強固な基盤を持っていた伊予松山藩出身の知識人たち（池内信嘉・高浜虚子）の後援があった。
sen.e: Also the school had support from an intellectuals from the Iyo-Matsuyama Domain (such as Nobuyoshi IKENOUCHI and Kyoshi TAKAHAMA), who had strong foundation as Su-utai (Noh lyrics without music) instructor since Edo Period.

sen.e: The school is known for practicing Su-utai instruction enthusiastically, and the fact was reflected on literatus, such as Kyoshi TAKAHAMA, Hekigoto KAWAHIGASHI and Soseki NATSUME, being fond of the school.
